name: Logging
overview:
This class allows you interact with Google Cloud Logging.

First, install @google-cloud/logging with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/logging

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/loggingâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Compute Engine

var logging = require('@google-cloud/logging')();

Elsewhere

var logging = require('@google-cloud/logging')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/logging are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: Logging
methods.description:
This is a Beta release of Stackdriver Logging. This API is not covered by any SLA or deprecation policy and may be subject to backward-incompatible changes.

Stackdriver Logging allows you to store, search, analyze, monitor, and alert on log data and events from Google Cloud Platform and Amazon Web Services (AWS).

resources.title: Introduction to the Stackdriver Logging API

params.name: config.destination
params.description: • The destination. The proper ACL scopes will be granted to the provided destination.

params.name: config.filter
params.description: • An advanced logs filter. Only log entries matching the filter are written.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

exceptions.description: if a config object is not provided.

methods.name: entry
methods.description:
Create an entry object.

Note that using this method will not itself make any API requests. You will use the object returned in other API calls, such as logging/log#write.

params.name: data
params.description: • The data to use as the value for this log entry.

examples.caption: To control how many API requests are made and page through the results manually, set autoPaginate to false.
Get the entries from your project as a readable object stream.
If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing and API requests.

params.name: options.filter
params.description: • An advanced logs filter. An empty filter matches all log entries.

params.name: options.maxApiCalls
params.description: • Maximum number of API calls to make.

params.name: options.orderBy
params.description: • How the results should be sorted, timestamp (oldest first) and timestamp desc (newest first, default).

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: • A previously-returned page token representing part of the larger set of results to view.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: getSinks
methods.description: Get the sinks associated with this project.

examples.caption: Get the sinks from your project as a readable object stream.
If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing and API requests.

params.name: options.maxApiCalls
params.description: • Maximum number of API calls to make.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: log
methods.description: Get a reference to a Stackdriver Logging log.

methods.name: sink
methods.description: Get a reference to a Stackdriver Logging sink.
